cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the western Florida Panhandle
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle near Panama City, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Panhandle coast from the Alabama/Florida border to Navarre (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Panhandle coast from Navarre to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line (Tropical Storm Warning); Storm-surge warning Indian Pass to Yankeetown
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Big Bend and western Florida Panhandle, coastal Alabama and adjacent northern Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts up to 30 mph possible, otherwise breezy
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 3â€“5 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts producing brief urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk in outer rainbands mainly west coast of Florida; minimal threat at Port Everglades
